title: >>> THREEpeat?
body_text:
Consistency
is the perfect word to describe the past two events. DODGEBALL LXIV and DODGEBALL LXV, right in the midst of the 7th dodgeball season, practically mirrored each other. Heading into the 66th event, taking a look at the past two encounters has left many with unanswered questions. Will the unsolved mysteries finally be solved?
I: LIGHTS OUT!
Perhaps the biggest mystery concerns the apparent light failure. For two straight events, a small lamppost has catered the events as best as possible and though LXIV and LXV suceeded, the absence of the bright spotlights have taken from the game. The reason for the troubles remains unknown to this day. But it goes without saying many are hoping that's the last of
Dark Dodgeball
for quite some time.
II: TAKING OUT THE TRASH ...
It's because of the light failure the trash cans have returned. To some, it's a nostalgic feel. But in reality, the trash cans may not even be included if it weren't for the lighting troubles. If the lights aren't funtioning, expect DODGEBALL 66 to spill onto the front courts once again.
III: BEGGING FOR MORE!
DODGEBALL LX3 is considered a timeless event as it marked the return, and defeat, of the controversial group known as Pond Scum. Since then, "The Green Machines" have challenged not once, but twice, in an effort to extract some revenge. But it is well known that at both LXIV and LXV, they no-showed the events, leaving the warriors of Wall High School in a state of turmoil. Not a word has been said leading up to DODGEBALL 66 in regards to Pond Scum, which leaves many to believe they haven't the slightest intentions of coming. But counting out this legendary group out isn't exactly the safest idea, and in the great sport of dodgeball, anything can happen.
IV: DODGEBALL PIZZA ...
Adjacent to Wall High School itself lies a small pizzaria owned by a man named Luke. For the past couple events, he has kindly given away free pizza to the dodgeball stars; a sure way to add excitement to an already fun-filled evening. Those who have come to dodgeball upset have surely gone home happy thanks to his generosity. Will the popular pizza-man return with even more cheese pizza?
V: FIRST TIMERS ...
Kathryn Nogueira vs. Aimee Savoth
and
Sascha Basista vs. Joey Smalls
were the main events for LXIV and LXV, respectively. It was these now classic confrontations that have seen four new players rise as first time captains. Will DODGEBALL 66 witness another pair of inexperienced combatants?
FUTURE SCHEDULE
DODGEBALL 67
Saturday, December 9th, 2006
6:30pm at Wall High School
DODGEBALL 68
Saturday, December 16th, 2006
6:30pm at Wall High School
DODGEBALL 69
Saturday, December 23rd, 2006
6:30pm at Wall High School
*This event could change*
DODGEBALL 70
Saturday, December 30th, 2006
6:30pm at Wall High School
